page.title: 12Cauldon Lowe School
page.content: Cauldon Lowe School opened in 1846 and closed in 1980 along with the other small primary schools in the area. The children were transferred to Waterhouses First and Middle Schools. The building was sold and became the Staffordshire Peak Arts Centre. Here are a child's memories of his early years at that school: I started to school when I was 5 and left when I was 8. In school there was a hall also used as the dining room. Another room with a partition down the middle housed two classes. There were two teachers. Outside there was a climbing frame and when the bell went we used to run outside and scramble to the top. We had a shed which contained equipment, including pogo-sticks and stilts. I was always good at pogoing but I always fell off the stilts.
